intro: Samyda acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed samyda, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have pointed tips. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Samyda acuminata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
